DOC.brief_summary: This trial design evaluate efficacy acupuncture pain relief patient discogenic sciatica compare sham acupuncture .
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Sciatica primarily cause herniated discs nerve-root compression . Acupuncture may effectively relieve pain discogenic sciatica , evidence limit . Methods/Design : Sixty patient discogenic sciatica recruit randomized receive acupuncture sham-acupuncture 1:1 ratio . Patients group receive treatment 3 time per week 4 week . The following acupoints use : Dachang shu ( BL 25 ) , Shenshu ( BL 23 ) , Weizhong ( BL 40 ) , Chengshan ( BL 57 ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Unilateral leg pain diagnose discogenic sciatica ; 2 . Sciatica patient average leg pain VAS 40 mm high last 24 hour ; 3 . Aged 18 75 year ; 4 . Leg pain correlate CT MRI finding lumbar disc herniation ; 5 . Patients agree follow trial protocol . 1 . Severe case central giant rupture lumbar disc herniation , cauda equina syndrome , foot drop , surgery requirement ; 2 . Progressive neurological symptom 3 month strict conservative treatment ( e.g. , nerve root adhesion , cross straightleg testing , obvious muscle atrophy ) ; 3 . Severe cardiovascular , liver , kidney , hematopoietic system disease , autoimmune disease , poor nutritional status ; 4 . Subjects cognitive impairment ; 5 . Pregnancy ; 6 . Subjects receive acupuncture sciatica within past month .
